member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger
member.summary: Abstract implementation for ILogger, which safes some time. In general you will only need to implement Write (without exception) as: 1) WriteLine in calls Write after appending a newline. 2) WriteLine with Exception calls WriteLine with the template/parameters and again with the Exception.ToString()

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.Configure(Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration)
member.summary: Configure the logger with the supplied configuration, values are copied.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.Format(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This function can be changed to format the line message differently First argument is the LogInfo, second the messageTemplate, third the parameters

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.LogLevel
member.summary: Use this to specify the LogLevels enum

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.UseShortSource
member.summary: Defines if the Source is written like d.l.LoggerTest (default) or Dapplo.Log.Facade.LoggerTest

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Timestamp format which is used in the output, when outputting the LogInfo details

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.LogLineFormat
member.summary: Default line format for loggers which use the DefaultFormatter. The first argument is the LogInfo, the second the message + parameters formatted

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.IsLogLevelEnabled(Dapplo.Log.LogLevels,Dapplo.Log.LogSource)
member.summary: Test if a certain LogLevels enum is enabled, optionally the LogSource for which this is requested is supplied and can be used.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.ReplacedWith(Dapplo.Log.ILogger)
member.summary: Override this if you need to move your content into a different logger which replaces "you"

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.Write(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Write a message with parameters to the logger
member.param: object array with the parameters for the template

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.WriteLine(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: WriteLine, default wraps to write, passes a message with parameters to the logger and appends a newline
member.param: object array with the parameters for the template

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.AbstractLogger.WriteLine(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: WriteLine with Exception calls WriteLine with messageTemplate / logParameters and WriteLine with the exception as string
member.param: object array with the parameters for the template

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.ILogger
member.summary: This is the interface used for internal logging. The idea is that you can implement a small wrapper for you favorite logger which implements this interface. Assign it to the HttpExtensionsGlobals.Logger and Dapplo.HttpExtensions will start logger with your class. A TraceLogger implementation is supplied, so you can see some output while your project is in development.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.ILogger.Configure(Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration)
member.summary: Configure the logger with the values from the ILoggerConfiguration

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.ILogger.Format(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This can be overriden to format the line message differently

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.ILogger.ReplacedWith(Dapplo.Log.ILogger)
member.summary: This is called when your logger was the default, and is replaced with a different one. In this method a buffer logger could place all it's content into the new logger.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.ILogger.IsLogLevelEnabled(Dapplo.Log.LogLevels,Dapplo.Log.LogSource)
member.summary: A simple test, to see if the log level is enabled. Note: level == LogLevels.None should always return false Level == LogLevels.None is actually checked in the extension Optionally the LogSource for which this is requested is supplied and can be used.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.ILogger.Write(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This writes the LogInfo, messageTemplate and the log parameters to the log
member.param: LogInfo with source, timestamp, level etc

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.ILogger.WriteLine(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This writes the LogInfo, messageTemplate and the log parameters to the log, finishing with a newline
member.param: LogInfo with source, timestamp, level etc

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.ILogger.WriteLine(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This writes the LogInfo, exception, messageTemplate and the log parameters to the log, finishing with a newline
member.param: LogInfo with source, timestamp, level etc

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration
member.summary: Interface for the LoggerConfiguration

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration.LogLevel
member.summary: The LogLevels enum a logger uses

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration.UseShortSource
member.summary: Defines if the Source is written like d.l.LoggerTest (default) or Dapplo.Log.Facade.LoggerTest

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Timestamp format which is used in the output, when outputting the LogInfo details

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration.LogLineFormat
member.summary: Default line format for loggers which use the DefaultFormatter. The first argument is the LogInfo, the second the message + parameters formatted

member.summary: The default lookup implementation

member.summary: Takes care of registering the supplied logger for a certain source

member.summary: Takes care of registering the supplied logger for a LogSource

member.summary: Takes care of registering the supplied logger for a certain source

member.summary: Takes care of registering the supplied logger for a certain source

member.summary: Takes care of de-registering the supplied logger for a certain source

member.summary: Takes care of de-registering the supplied logger for a LogSource

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LoggerMapper.DeregisterLoggerFor(System.Type,Dapplo.Log.ILogger)
member.summary: Takes care of de-registering the supplied logger for a certain source

member.summary: Takes care of de-registering the supplied logger for a certain source

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.LogInfo
member.summary: A simple wrapper for some information which is passed to the logger

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogInfo.LogLevel
member.summary: The LogLevels enum for the log

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogInfo.Line
member.summary: The line of the log

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogInfo.Method
member.summary: Method in the Caller (class) from where the log statement came

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogInfo.Source
member.summary: Class from where the log statement came

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogInfo.Timestamp
member.summary: Timestamp for the log

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogInfo.ToString
member.summary: Create a string representation of the LogInfo, this by default has a timestamp, level, source, method and line. If the format needs to be changed, LogSettings.LogInfoFormatter can be assigned with your custom formatter Func

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.LogInfoExtensions
member.summary: The extensions for making logging easy and flexible

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogInfoExtensions.Write(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This extension method passes the messageTemplate and parameters to the loggers Write method.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogInfoExtensions.WriteLine(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This extension method passes the messageTemplate and parameters to the loggers WriteLine method.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogInfoExtensions.WriteLine(Dapplo.Log.LogInfo,System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: This extension method passes the Exception, messageTemplate and parameters to the loggers WriteLine method.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels
member.summary: Log level for the log facade, default(LogLevel) gives None which doesn't log anything LogLevels.None is actually checked internally, before IsLogLevelEnabled.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels.None
member.summary: Default, no logging

member.name: F:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels.Verbose
member.summary: Verbose logs pretty much everything

member.name: F:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels.Debug
member.summary: Debugging information, usually needed when troubleshooting

member.name: F:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels.Info
member.summary: Informational logging

member.name: F:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels.Warn
member.summary: Warn that something didn't went well

member.name: F:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels.Error
member.summary: Used for logging real errors

member.name: F:Dapplo.Log.LogLevels.Fatal
member.summary: Used for unrecoverable problems

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.LogSettings
member.summary: This is to specify global settings for the Log "framework"

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogSettings.DefaultLoggerConfiguration
member.summary: Default configuration, if any

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogSettings.DefaultLogger
member.summary: The default logger used, if the logger implements IDisposable it will be disposed if another logger is assigned

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogSettings.LoggerLookup
member.summary: This function is responsible for finding the right loggers for a LogSource. Default implementation is from the LoggerMapper.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSettings.RegisterDefaultLogger``1(Dapplo.Log.ILoggerConfiguration,System.Object[])
member.summary: Takes care of registering the default logger with a logger, configuration and arguments
member.param: ILoggerConfiguration to configure the logger with
member.returns: The newly created logger, this might be needed elsewhere

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSettings.RegisterDefaultLogger``1(Dapplo.Log.LogLevels,System.Object[])
member.summary: Takes care of registering the default logger with a logger, LogLevel and arguments
member.returns: The newly created logger, this might be needed elsewhere

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSettings.ReplaceDefaultLogger(Dapplo.Log.ILogger)
member.summary: Helper method to replace the default logger

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.LogSource
member.summary: This defines the "source" (origin) for log statements, it should have a Type or a identifier (string) so it's clear where the log entries come from. In general this should be instanciated with the default constructor without arguments, which takes care of initiating it. For normal .NET 4.5 this uses the Stack to find the type which called the constructor. For other platforms this uses the CallerFilePath, which supplies the source-file.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: The constructor for specifying the type manually
member.param: Type for the LogSource, not null

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Private constructor used internally, to differenciate from the empty constructor

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The NON desktop default constructor which should be called without an argument. It will use the CallerFilePath attribute, to make sure the source file is passed as an argument.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.ForCustomSource(System.String)
member.summary: Factory method where you can specify the type manually
member.param: A custom identifier for the LogSource

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.SetSourceFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Use a string to set the source information

member.name: M:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.SetSourceFromType(System.Type)
member.summary: Use a type to set the source information

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.SourceType
member.summary: The Type where this LogSource was created

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.ShortSource
member.summary: The Type, as string, where this LogSource was created Every part of the namespace is shortened to one letter. e.g. this class would return d.l.LogSource

member.name: P:Dapplo.Log.LogSource.Source
member.summary: The Type, as string, where this LogSource was created e.g. this class would return Dapplo.Log.Facade.LogSource

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.LogSourceExtensions
member.summary: The extensions for making logging easy and flexible

member.summary: Test if LogLevels.Debug is enabled

member.summary: Test if LogLevels.Error enabled

member.summary: A simple test, to see if the log level is enabled. Note: logLevel == LogLevels.None should always return false logLevel == LogLevels.None is actually checked in the extension
member.returns: true if there are loggers which will log for the LogSource

member.summary: This helper method will create LogInfo, if there is anything to log to
member.param: LogContext is the context (source) from where the log entry came
Should be set by the compiler, int lineNumber of the log statement
Should be set by the compiler, is the calling method

member.name: T:Dapplo.Log.NullLogger
member.summary: An null logger, doesn't log anything! This can be used to shut-up certain LogSources
